snippet: With Russia’s economy in a downturn, Germany could be in a prime spot to leverage a peaceful end to the upheaval in Ukraine.
abstract: News analysis; Germany, as Russia's prime trading partner, appears crucial to ending crisis in Ukraine; it is heavily reliant on Russia for its energy needs, yet its enhanced status on world stage, combined with onset of economic stagnation in Russia, has shifted balance of power.

byline.contributor: Jack Ewing and Stanley Reed contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: With Russia’s economy in a downturn, Germany could be in a prime spot to leverage a peaceful end to the upheaval in Ukraine.

headline.main: As Prime Russian Trading Partner, Germany Appears Crucial to Ending Crisis
headline.print_headline: As Prime Russian Trading Partner, Germany Appears Crucial to Ending Crisis
